testcase.brief: When eth0 with access mode, Mac-learning be enabled, connected client with eth0 will be reported to HM
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: Set interface eth0 to access mode and enable mac-learning: Interface eth0 mode bridge-access Interface eth0 mac-learning enable Enable http: Alg http enable AP connect with HM _debug auth basic _debug auth info _debug auth comm Debug console
Test Procedure: 1. Connect a PC to switch 2. Show interface eth0 mac-learning all to check client info 3. Show auth to check if default so be bind to eth0 4. Show auth to check if connected client be learned by eth0, check client info (vlan, upid, MAC, Interface) 5. Open a webpage from client, show roaming cache mac xxxx:yyyy:zzzz to check client info(IP, hostname, vlan, upid, OS, interface) 6. Show route to check if corresponding route be added, check if upid is correct (free arp) 7. Check if connected client be reported to HM(?)

step.desc: config BR with WAN interface, nat enable, config mgt0.1
step.console: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server enable" -v "exec bypass-wan-hardening"

step.desc: check traffic through wan on BR
HTTP enable and connect to HM
step.telnet: -v "alg http enable" -v "capwap client enable" -v "capwap client server name ${pub.hm1.ip}"

step.log-match: -ps p "RUN state: Connected securely to the CAPWAP server" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}

step.telnet: -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}"
-v "_debug auth basic" -v "_debug auth info" -v "_debug auth comm" -v "_debug capwap basic" -v "_debug capwap trap" -v "clear log buf"

step.setvar: echo $(echo $(echo $(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f1)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f2,3)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f4,5)$(echo ${br1.vpc1.tif.mac1} | cut -d : -f6)) | tr "A-F" "a-f")

step.desc: set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
2. Show interface eth0 mac-learning all to check client info
3. Show auth to check if default so be bind to eth0
4. Show auth to check if connected client be learned by eth0, check client info (vlan, upid, MAC, Interface)
6. Show route to check if corresponding route be added, check if upid is correct (free arp)
7. Check if connected client be reported to HM
